page.title: 18MORGAN'S TYNINGS FARM
page.content: We interviewed Mrs.Clark, wife of the owner of the farm. She told us the farm is 200 acres or 80 hectares. They keep beef cattle. They grow wheat and barley. The most profitable crop is winter wheat.For machinery they have 5 tractors,1 combine harvester,1 baler, 2 ploughs, disc harrows, drag harrows, a muck spreader, various trailers, a sprayer and a fertilizer spreader. The farm buildings are hay & straw barns, cattle sheds, old stables and the farm house.There is 1 worker per 40 hectares.The animals are fed on own hay & barley + bought concentrate. The animals are sold at Cirencester & Tetbury markets & the grain to Tetbury Mills.Field sports across their land fox hunting and beagling ( catching hares with dogs called beagle hounds) They have mains electricity & water from Chelworth Water Board.
